channel.title: [PI] Dungeoneering
channel.description: My dungeoneering is messed up. When you kill monsters, it doesn't reward the points.

item.title: [PI] Dungeoneering
item.dc:creator: @l0lc0pt3r l0lc0pt3r
item.description:
@l0lc0pt3r wrote:

i kinda lied here -.- messed up. do it like this, in npchandler under public void dropitems(int i)

if (npcs[i].npcType == ***) {//*** = npcid c.getPA().movePlayer(**, ***, ****);/*optional(if you want the player to move after killing this npc) **= x coord *** = y coord **** = height*/ c.getItems().addItem(***, 10);//this is for a physical item change *** to the itemid, then amount(10) c.dungpoints += 10;//change to your variable + how ever much u want c.sendMessage("your message here");//use this to send a message when its killed }

just remove wont you wont use, if its not a physical item remove the c.getItems().addItem line, if you dont want to send a message, delete sendMessage line, etc. this should work, post errors though if you get any

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Dungeoneering
item.dc:creator: @Nonamee Nonamee
item.description:
@Nonamee wrote:

[quote=“l0lc0pt3r, post:2, topic:410570”]if your point is like pk points then do it like this,

if (npcs[i].npcType == ###) {//change ### to the npc id #
c.dungpoints += 10;//change to your variable + how ever much u want
}

if its an item

c.getItems().addItem(####, 10);/change c.dungpoints += 10; to that, change #### to the item id, and 10 to the amount u want./

or just plain and simple, add it to the drops of the npc.[/quote]

Where exactly?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Dungeoneering
item.dc:creator: @l0lc0pt3r l0lc0pt3r
item.description:
@l0lc0pt3r wrote:

if your point is like pk points then do it like this,

if (npcs[i].npcType == ###) {//change ### to the npc id # c.dungpoints += 10;//change to your variable + how ever much u want }

if its an item

c.getItems().addItem(####, 10);/*change c.dungpoints += 10; to that, change #### to the item id, and 10 to the amount u want.*/

or just plain and simple, add it to the drops of the npc.
